description: Dive into "Romantic Escapes in Brighton's Charm" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Romantic Escapes in Brighton's Charm

places.generalDescription: Brighton Pier is a popular tourist spot dominating the seafront with its traditional British charm. While it's not dog-friendly, the beachfront from the pier to the Marina welcomes furry friends and offers stunning sea views. Nearby, you can hop on the Volks Electric Railway, created by Victorian engineer Magnus Volks, providing a unique way to explore the area. Visitors can enjoy recreational activities and witness mesmerizing murmurations of starlings while taking in breathtaking views of the sea.

sources.snippet: With its combination of fun, food, and stunning views, Sixes Brighton offers a memorable and romantic spot for couples to enjoy a day out together. Whether youâ€™re sharing a meal, playing cricket, or simply enjoying each otherâ€™s company by the sea, Sixes Brighton provides the perfect blend of romance and adventure in one of the cityâ€™s most picturesque settings.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

sources.snippet: Whether itâ€™s your first date or your twentieth date, this attraction always guarantees a good time. With arcade games and rollercoasters, these rides will give you the thrill of your life. Just be sure to admire the picturesque view of Brighton from the top of the Turbo Coaster!
sources.shortName: things to do in brighton for couples

places.name: Brighton Palace Pier

reviews.text:
We visited this lovely,nostalgic pier in July. It was midweek but before the summer holidays and still had plenty of families enjoying the amusements,stalls,shops,food outlets and fairground rides.
The pier has plenty of seating and offers exceptional views of the beautiful beaches on both sides.
If you wish to partake of the great selection of rides,it works out cheaper to work out which ones you want to ride and buy a card instead of individual tokens.
The ice creams were also absolutely delicious ðŸ˜‹

Nice to walk around and enjoy the sea view, but the visit is quite short. The pier is mostly filled with attractions, arcade games, and lots of food stalls (churros, donuts, etc.), so not much else to really do. Still, it's a beautiful spot and worth seeing for the view over the sea and the coastline.

Such a fun spot to wander around! Seaside fun with arcades, rides, and all the snacks you could want. The views out over the water are beautiful, and there's a lively, nostalgic atmosphere. Perfect for a stroll, a few cheeky snacks, and soaking up the coastal vibes.

places.address: Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1TW, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Palace Pier, which opened in 1899, is a historic and thrilling destination offering fairground rides, bars, restaurants, and stunning sea views. Visitors can enjoy street performers and ocean vistas before exploring popular eateries and bars inside the pier. The boardwalk offers opportunities for souvenir shopping while indulging in sweet treats. Families can delight in arcade games, midway attractions, sideshow entertainment, and exhilarating roller coasters.

sources.snippet: Something you just cannot miss off your Brighton itinerary is a walk down the iconic Palace Pier, especially if you are a thrill seeker who would never pass on an opportunity for a go on a few roller coasters, and maybe the chance to win a prize at the arcade. Itâ€™s also an ideal spot if you just want to rest your feet after a dayâ€™s shopping, do a bit of people watching and munch on the delicious pier donuts or ice cream overlooking the sea. In the early evening, youâ€™ll spot the stunning starling murmurations too.
sources.shortName: The most romantic way to spend 48 hours in Brighton

sources.snippet: It doesnâ€™t mean you have to do the same old cliched Valentineâ€™s Day expressions of love as everyone else, like: winning a giant teddy on the Palace Pier, going for cocktails, getting a tattoo of your partnerâ€™s name, or taking a sunset selfie on the bandstand.
sources.shortName: 20 Alternative Romantic Things to Do in Brighton

sources.snippet: Whether youâ€™re more into arcade games or rollercoasters â€“ the pier has something for everyone. Go through the rite of passage for every couple by trying to win a soft toy from the claw machines as a treasured memory.
sources.shortName: Winter Date Spots in Brighton -
23 of the Best Ever Brighton Date Ideas

places.name: Brighton Palace Pier

reviews.text:
We visited this lovely,nostalgic pier in July. It was midweek but before the summer holidays and still had plenty of families enjoying the amusements,stalls,shops,food outlets and fairground rides.
The pier has plenty of seating and offers exceptional views of the beautiful beaches on both sides.
If you wish to partake of the great selection of rides,it works out cheaper to work out which ones you want to ride and buy a card instead of individual tokens.
The ice creams were also absolutely delicious ðŸ˜‹

Nice to walk around and enjoy the sea view, but the visit is quite short. The pier is mostly filled with attractions, arcade games, and lots of food stalls (churros, donuts, etc.), so not much else to really do. Still, it's a beautiful spot and worth seeing for the view over the sea and the coastline.

Brighton Palace Pier is the heart of the city's seaside charm. A lovely place to stroll along the beach, enjoy the sea breeze, and take in the views - even when the waves are a little wild. The pier is full of fun attractions and games, perfect for families, couples, or friends. At night, the lights create a magical atmosphere that makes it a must-see when visiting Brighton.

places.address: Madeira Dr, Brighton, BN2 1TW, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Royal Pavilion in Brighton is a unique and distinctive palace built for King George IV, featuring an Asian-style architecture that resembles the Taj Mahal. Constructed in three stages starting from 1787, this former royal residence boasts restored rooms such as the Banqueting Room, The Saloon, and The Great Kitchen. Surrounded by Pavilion Gardens, it has been well-maintained over the years and is a popular filming location for various movies.

sources.snippet: Built in the early 19 th century in 1823,  The Royal Pavilion is a Grade I listed palace that was previously the royal residence for King George IV. The palace combines Indian architecture with a Chinese-inspired interior, making it a great way to spend a few hours exploring the ornate features of the pavilion, as well as the gardens outside. If you want to add an extra romantic touch to your visit to the Royal Pavilion, you can have a spot of lunch with your partner at the tea rooms.
sources.shortName: What are the Most Romantic Things to do in Brighton?

sources.snippet: Exploring Brighton on two wheels allows you to take in iconic spots like the Royal Pavilion, Brighton Pier, The Lanes, and Brighton Beach, all while enjoying each otherâ€™s company. Some tours even extend to the scenic South Downs National Park, offering a blend of city and nature.
sources.shortName: Top 7 Fun and Exciting Things to Do in Brighton for Couples

sources.snippet: For couples who want to spend a full day in Brighton, Sixes Brightonâ€™s convenient beachfront location makes it easy to combine with a visit to other romantic spots like the Brighton Pier, Royal Pavilion Gardens, or a leisurely stroll along the Brighton Beach Boardwalk.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

sources.snippet: When winter rolls around, the Royal Pavilion's ice rink becomes the most romantic spot in town. Hold hands as you glide (or wobble) around this stunning historical backdrop.
sources.shortName: 23 of the Best Ever Brighton Date Ideas

places.name: Royal Pavilion

reviews.text:
WOW!!!
The outside is fantastic and over the top, the interiors are that and then some - sumptuous, gawdy, luxurious almost tacky! But so worth seeing.
An adult ticket is about Â£20 but allows unlimited re entry for 12 months, excellent value.  There is so much to see and it's nice making use of the occasional seats to sit and take in the intricate detail of the decor.
Lots of info boards  and there is an attendant (for want of a better word) in every room who are welcoming and knowledgeable.
There's an interesting gift shop too  with usual and not so usual souvenirs and gifts.  The coffee shop is worth a visit too, sit outside in the shadow of the Chinese gate and eat delicious Chocolate and Beetroot Fudge Cake!

So wonderfully over the top, I particularly enjoyed the Colour exhibition which offered a fascinating insight into the use and development of colour. Not my first visit, but there's always something new to see. Highly recommended. The gift shop is a mine of must have books and decorative items. I love the plate I bought.

Quite the amazing experience and not what I expected.  We are not royal followers but loved this place.  Indian style architecture on the exterior with much more east asian influenced art on the interior.  Gorgeous interiors with so much detail, the opulence of it all astounded us and made us sad at the same time.  Amazingly well restored to its original state.  Even the behind the scenes like the kitchen were impressive.  Spent about 45 minutes.  National Art Pass had free admission included.

places.address: 4/5 Pavilion Buildings, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1EE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton Dome is an elegant Regency building that serves as the south coast's premier multi-arts venue. It hosts over 600 events annually, including music, theatre, dance, comedy, literature, visual arts, and more. The magnificent grade listed building has been a prominent part of the community for over 200 years and has a rich history of transformations. Inside the art deco glamour of Brighton Dome offers a diverse range of shows from classical and contemporary music to modern dance and comedy performances.

sources.snippet: Not far from the Pavilion is the Brighton Dome, an iconic venue known for its stunning architecture and cultural significance. It was once the stable complex for the Pavilion and now serves as a creative hub for music and performing arts. Attending a concert here can be a magical experience, as the music and historic setting combine to create an unforgettable evening.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

places.name: Brighton Dome

reviews.text: Great venue and great staff. I was over from Spain with my wife and two kids for the Father John Misty concert. The security guard Diggory AKA Diggs was very kind, professional and helpful even making sure my kids had water on a hot night. So big thanks to him and all the staff. Great acoustics and great venue
Excellent historical venue for live music. Good views of stage around auditorium.  Sound always first class.  Drinks a bit pricy!

Went to see Greg Davies who was excellent, the Dome has such a great atmosphere and an excellent place to watch any show. The seating within the Dome gives you great viewing angles unlike some other places, so spending the extra money on closer seats isn't needed. The staff are very polite and helpful.

places.address: Church St, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1UE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Terre Ã  Terre is a renowned vegetarian restaurant in Brighton, offering world-inspired dishes in a vibrant setting. The restaurant has been a fixture in the city for over 20 years and is known for its sophisticated plant-led menu. Led by chefs Amanda Powley and Philip Taylor, the establishment prides itself on using unique ingredients from around the globe to create an exciting dining experience.

sources.snippet: Treat your loved one to lunch or dinner at Brightonâ€™s restaurant royalty, Terre a Terre and youâ€™ll be guaranteed Brownie points for effort. This Lane based restaurant has been the pioneering go-to destination for elevated Brighton vegetarian cuisine in Brighton since 1993 and has received Michelin approval for their efforts. If the sound of â€˜no fuss fine diningâ€™ on modern British dishes and supping on organic wines tugs on your heart strings, then book now for ultimate vegetarian indulgence.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants Brighton | Eating and Drinking for Date Night

places.name: terre Ã  terre

reviews.text:
Visited for the first time and had the afternoon tea for two. The service was impeccable, our server talked us through the menu and was incredibly attentive and reassuring about allergies.

The food and drink selection was amazing, with a savoury plate preceding the three tiers of sweets. The amount of food was enormous for only Â£30/pp, we were impressed by both the quantity and quality!

As a meat eater, I was ready to be impressed by what could be done with just vegetables. Reading the menu, I was quite excited. The experience at this restaurant was 5 star. The service, the food. The drinks. I could have eaten anything on the menu and the dishes we did have were AMAZING. I am certainly one very impressed Omnivore.

Absolutely wonderful vegetarian restaurant in Brighton! The food is spectacular and presented like it's a work of art. Everything we ate tasted divine. The Snap and Crackle chocolate dessert was out of this world! Friendly and welcoming staff too. Highly recommended for a magical, vegetarian dining experience.

places.address: 71 East St, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1HQ, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Brighton i360 is a futuristic glass pod with a cocktail bar that offers breathtaking views of the ocean and city. Families visiting Brighton can enjoy the seafront area, with its 4-mile-long beach, old-school pier rides, and SEA LIFE Brighton. The charming Queens Hotel provides family rooms right on the beach, while The Claremont in Hove offers a quieter option with generous guest rooms in a Victorian villa.

sources.snippet: One of the most romantic aspects of Sixes Brighton is its 100-person terrace overlooking the stunning Brighton seafront. The terrace offers breathtaking views of the beach and the Brighton skyline, creating the perfect backdrop for a romantic date by the sea. Whether youâ€™re sipping cocktails as the sun sets or enjoying a relaxed lunch while watching the waves, the terrace provides an intimate and scenic setting for couples to enjoy quality time together.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

sources.snippet: The late night ride of the Brighton i360, sipping a glass of bubbly, is definitely top of my list, soaring above the Brighton skyline. For the wine connoisseur, take in a private Wine Tasting at Ten Green Bottles in Jubilee Street. Fine wines and your own personal qualified sommelier to guide your through the best tastes.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Brighton for Couples

sources.snippet: Brighton i360 offers one of the most unique dining and drinking experiences on the south coast, inviting guests to enjoy a magical escapade 450 feet in the ...
sources.shortName: 39 Romantic Restaurants near Brighton

places.name: Brighton i360

reviews.text:
An awesome place to visit either before or after walking around Brighton.
It's not free but definitely not too expensive
You can appreciate the history of Brighton and the surrounding area from above, something that can only be realised once you get there.
To make it even better, they have a bar where a refreshing drink can be purchased.
Highly recommended.

Worth booking ahead to save a little money. Â£20 each person. The i360 holds maximum 200 people.
Views were fantastic. Best on a clear sunny day. Or evening sunset.
Bar service was great. We enjoyed a glass of champagne as we travelled upwards to the highest spot.

Went on a good day, was a nice experience the guys had champagne bottle at the top and pizza at the bottom. Great views we were lucky clear sky, no wait time. I am told online tickets are slightly cheaper. Perhaps ease up on the "pre-flight" red tape.

places.address: Lower Kings Road, Brighton, BN1 2LN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Salt Room is a chic and modern British restaurant located in Brighton, offering stunning sea views and a terrace for alfresco dining. It has been recognized as the Seafood Restaurant of the Year in 2017, known for its sustainable and locally sourced seafood dishes. The menu, crafted by Chef Dave Mothersill, features an array of freshly prepared seafood options such as cuttlefish, oysters, lobster, and sea bass.

sources.snippet: Dubbed as the place for grown-up socials, Burnt Orange is the youngest sister in the triad of acclaimed Brighton restaurants, including The Coal Shed and The Salt Room. Table reservations for here are in high demand. So, if you do manage to bag a reservation you can be pretty certain that your guest will be impressed.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants Brighton | Eating and Drinking for Date Night

sources.snippet: Brighton is renowned for its exceptional seafood â€“ from oysters to salmon, you can enjoy their fresh fish and other delicious seafood on the menu.
sources.shortName: things to do in brighton for couples

places.name: The Salt Room

reviews.text: I visited The Salt Room with my wife tonight for her birthday. We were greeted at the door by a French Manager who was very friendly, with a great accent. He sat us at a lovely table by the window and made sure we were very well looked after. Our waiter was Gabor, who similarly was very friendly and genuinely only interested to ensure we had a lovely experience. He filleted out fish in front of us and took time to recommend all the specials. The food was absolutely fantastic. My favourite of all the dishes was the dover sole. Even the desserts at the end were fantastic. We will definitely be back soon and would recommend this restaurant to anyone. Fantastic food, but absolutely the staff made our evening so special. It felt like nothing was too much trouble for them.

We had a fantastic lunch here mid week. The food quality is quite simply outstanding, and as for the shellfish I have to say we were delighted. My wife and I have just returned from a 2 month stay in the Algarve's biggest fishing port where seafood and fresh fish is obviously plentiful so we were wondering how we would fare on our return to the UK after that. We were not disappointed, the XL prawns were locally sourced, fresh and absolutely delicous. The ribeye steak was perfectly cooked and the Piri-piri Monkfish my wife had was also excellent. It's not cheap, but it's more than a meal - it's an experience - the wines, top class service and ambiance all adds to it and the hosts clearly take great pride in what they do, so it's worth paying the extra if you can afford it. They claim it's Brighton's best seafood restaurant and I have no reason to doubt that. It's certainly a high bar.

Looking forward to coming back one day, sadly we don't get to Brighton more than once a year.

We visited recently to celebrate my daughter's graduation. We had an excellent time. Our waitress was amazing and she really looked after us. Food was good but we felt portions were a bit on the smaller size. It does not matter. We had an incredible time! They even brought my daughter a complimentary dessert to celebrate her graduation. Thank you so much.

places.address: 106 Kings Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 2FU, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Be At One - Brighton is a lively chain bar known for its sweet, sour, and spicy cocktails as well as mixing masterclasses. Located at the bottom of North Street near the Pier, this modern and chic cocktail bar offers around 120 cocktails, from classics to their own tasty creations. The bar itself features exposed brickwork and glistening tiles, creating a great atmosphere for late-night pleasure seekers.

sources.snippet: A small cosy bar with a great atmosphere and family free (over 18â€™s only), as well as good prices, especially a generous happy hour. Or you have Bohemia, with its jazz bar vibe and an amazing sun terrace on the roof so you can watch the sprawling streets go by below whilst you relax and get close.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Brighton for Couples

sources.snippet: Searching for things to do in Brighton at night for couples?. Give your evening a juicy twist at Be At One. The intimate little bar has every cocktail you could think of, and then some.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Brighton

places.name: Be At One - Brighton

reviews.text: My Hen Do! Oh my! It was so much fun! The atmosphere was on point, the service was fantastic,  great music and real positive vibes. We had a table booked (highly recommend) for 2 hours, and if we hadn't of had another booking, we would have stayed much longer! A real night to remember! Thank you to all the staff. My Sister is the newly crowned "Hen do Queen!"

My favourite place in Brighton cocktails! The assignment: glamour and class!
The vibe here is always good times and the clientele are friendly and out for a good time - none of that pretentious stuff here! Door staff are fair and tuned in.
The staff are so friendly and work so well in this busy vibrant environment. The cocktails are gorg! Try the raspberry beret or classic marg â™¥ï¸
Daniel and his team are incredible and it's a real safe space for women especially.
Cant recommend enough and definitely be returning super soon!

Cocktails are the best here!!! And the entertainment... always dancing! For the last 3 year's I have moved from the UK, I couldn't find the place where they would serve the same good quality cocktails! Love u guys ðŸ’•

places.address: 5 Castle Square, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1EG, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Preston Park, located in Brighton, is the city's largest urban park spanning 63 acres. It offers a range of activities including playgrounds, pitches, and a manor house. The park hosts various events such as concerts, fairs, and circuses. Visitors can enjoy picnics, sports like tennis and basketball, or explore the rock garden with its hidden waterfall and scenic views. Additionally, there are nearby eateries to satisfy any cravings after a day at Preston Park.

sources.snippet: It always surprises me that out of the thousands of visitors come to enjoy the nearby Preston Park every year, very few know about the rock garden opposite or its mysterious waterfall hidden within. The rock gardens are a delight to explore, filled with winding narrow paths, little nook around each corner, benches hidden in the treesâ€¦ Donâ€™t forget to stop to take in the view across to Preston Park from the top. Bonus tip: If youâ€™re feeling peckish, noteworthy nearby eateries include CafÃ© Rust, Pizza 500, Preston Park Tavern and Bardsleyâ€™s fish and chip shop.
sources.shortName: 20 Alternative Romantic Things to Do in Brighton

sources.snippet: Preston Park is one of the largest urban parks in the city, so what better way to spend a day in Brighton by having a picnic with your partner?. The park provides a great opportunity for couples to recharge from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and immerse themselves in nature. If you want to make the most out of your visit to Preston Park, then we recommend going on a nice hot summerâ€™s day.
sources.shortName: What are the Most Romantic Things to do in Brighton?

sources.snippet: Preston Park is one of the largest in the city and is a popular choice for couples looking for a quiet escape. Its wide open spaces are perfect for a leisurely stroll or a picnic under the shade of ancient trees. The park also hosts various seasonal flowers that add a splash of color to your visit, making it feel like youâ€™re walking through a living painting.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

places.name: Preston Park

reviews.text: Full of joy and friendly dogs. Tennis courts, a cafe, lots of open green spaces. Too busy for us unless it's raining haha x

Fantastic place to bring the children nice long walks and just across the road there's a rock garden that the little ones can have an adventure going up and down the rock path.
There's a sandy area with swings and slides and a few cafes on site what more do you need for a great day out
I love going to the rock gardens over the road with my son and partner to see the fishes and to go in the little waterfall

places.address: Preston Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 6SD, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Queen's Park is a 15-acre urban oasis that offers a variety of activities for visitors. Whether you're in the mood for a leisurely stroll, an invigorating bike ride, or a game of tennis, this park has something for everyone. The park features leafy gardens, a central pond, and even a wildlife garden created by a local herbalist. Visitors can also enjoy regular concerts and events held within the park.

sources.snippet: Queenâ€™s Park is a lesser-known oasis that provides a peaceful escape with its large pond, wildlife, and shaded paths. Couples can take a leisurely walk, sit by the water, or simply enjoy the natural surroundings in quiet companionship.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

places.name: Queen's Park

reviews.text: Beautiful park..with a beautiful pond .. swans swimming in it .. the park is a nature's delight.. squirrels, birds, swans... A very nice playground area for kids... Worth a visit

Fabulous park came to feed the ducks bit unfortunately it was more like feed the seagulls. The pond was covered in green stuff. But does have a brill play park for kids of all ages and a cafe. Plus a little sand pit area

Great park, with lots of open space to play, a small cafe on the road around the outside of the park, entrance approaching from west drive, one toilets in the children's park, areas for dogs, a quiet garden, tennis courts, ducks to feed and a large pond.

places.address: 1 West Dr, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 0QU, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Immerse yourself in a charming and cozy atmosphere at The Painting Pottery Cafe, where you can enjoy a delightful date painting your own pottery creations. With a variety of options to choose from, including magical fairy houses, cottage core teapots, and colorful plates, this original pottery painting center has been bringing arts and crafts magic to couples since 1999. Unleash your inner artist as you paint ceramic pots with over 100 different designs or create your own masterpiece.

sources.snippet: Picture the scene: you and your beau tucked away in a cute polka-dot cafÃ©, sipping on a flat white while painting your very own magical fairy house, a cottage core teapot or a colourful plate. With a range of beautiful pottery venues nestled in the streets of Brighton, you are sure to find the perfect quaint setting for a date of lovingly crafting your very own pottery creation, which will form a perfect addition to your home. Paint Pots Brighton is Brightonâ€™s original pottery painting centre, bringing the magic of arts and crafts to couples since 1999.
sources.shortName: Date Night In Brighton - Things For Couples To do

sources.snippet: If youâ€™re feeling a bit more artistic, then paint any of the 200 pottery items offered. This is a good option for a first date because you can get to know someone in a relaxed and creative environment.
sources.shortName: Winter Date Spots in Brighton -

places.name: The Painting Pottery Cafe

reviews.text: Had such a great time at The Pottery Painting CafÃ© in Brighton. The staff were super friendly and didn't make me feel dumb at all when I totally messed up my design-they actually helped me fix it, and somehow my cup turned out really nice in the end. There's a big selection of stuff to paint, and the prices are reasonable too. Honestly a really fun and chill solo date spot.

I have come here thrice already and each time it's been a lovely place to relax and be creative! The result of my mug I painted was absolutely beautiful and they have so many options of things to paint. The staff are all very helpful and attentive, it's a great atmosphere perfect for a day out with friends!

Amazing store with a cute option to design nice and unique ceramics. We did a 2h painting course. It was totally relaxing and fun. Highly recommended!
But remember the days they need to burn the material. Best option is to do it at the very beginning of your stay!

places.address: 31 North Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1YB, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Gingerman is a well-established and intimate modern European restaurant in Brighton, offering fixed-price 2 or 3-course seasonal menus. The menu features a variety of dishes with a hint of Brighton star 64 Degrees, such as mackerel with pickled cucumber and breaded oyster on a muffin, as well as duck liver and heart accompanied by duck nugget with miso glaze and pear.

sources.snippet: A small and intimate eatery, The Gingerman is a true gem situated just off of Brightonâ€™s seafront. The decor is cosy and inviting, with exposed brick walls and dark leather seating, and this combined with their philosophy to create uncomplicated, full-flavoured food, made from the freshest, highest quality seasonal produce makes for a perfect romantic meal in Brighton. Share one of their bottles of wine while you enjoy the great quality cuisine and why not round your date night off with a stroll along the beach?
sources.siteName: Seen in The City - Luxury London Travel Lifestyle Magazine
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Head for a Romantic Meal in Brighton

sources.snippet: Or one of my other favourites would be the Gingerman on Norfolk Square. A great fine dining experience and an amazing menu.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Brighton for Couples

places.name: The Gingerman

reviews.text:
I had the best night at The Gingerman and now consider it one of the best dining experiences in Brighton.

The food was to die for. Though not cheap (except a ridiculously good value prawn to start), it is well worth a visit on a special occasion. The staff and service and ambience created an unforgettable evening that will be difficult to replicate.

To start I had snacks salmon tacos and a grilled prawn. Despite the salmon tacos being delicious, the prawn stole the show, being meaty and sweet, and for Â£3.50 with the seaweed Alioli, I cannot complain. For starters, the bbq squid was the best looking dish of the night, stunning, with perfectly cooked squid, a sauce maybe a touch too sweet, but interesting textures and bold flavours. For mains, the lamb saddle could've been cut with a butter knife, paired with some simple but lovely veg, a jus made from the belly and some majorly crispy 100-layer chips, and you're on to a real winner. The puddings were also solid, and a great way to end a great meal!

My wife and I dined at Gingerman Restaurant, one of our favorite spots over the past few years. This visit marked our fourth time there. While the waitress was exceptional-friendly, attentive, and kind-the overall food experience fell short. Specifically the main course, a steak meal, was underwhelming and lacked flavor. Considering we spent Â£180, we left feeling disappointed by the food.

Perfect meal at The Gingerman this weekend, with a varied, surprisingly reasonably priced (given the quality), Sunday lunch menu that delivered in every way.

The skate wing was perfectly cooked, the roast beef was beautifully tender, and the starters were creative and boasted some really interesting flavour combinations. The service was superb too, friendly, knowledgable, and easygoing.

Looking forward to trying their normal menu asap.

places.address: 21A Norfolk Square, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 2PD, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Komedia Brighton is a vibrant performing arts venue located just a few minutes from Brighton Station in the lively North Laine area. This premier entertainment spot hosts over 700 performances annually, featuring a diverse range of shows including comedy, music, cabaret, and children's theatre. It is also known for showcasing popular comedy shows in Brighton and regularly participating in events like the Brighton Fringe Festival and The Great Escape.

sources.snippet: The Krater Comedy Nights at the Komedia are a must see â€“ with big name headliners, cheap grub and a fully stocked bar â€“ but my advice is, if youâ€™re on a first date maybe avoid the front row seats as youâ€™re bound to get involved with the comedy. Why donâ€™t you cosy up to each other at an outside screening?. Take in a late Friday night showing of a classic, or catch your favourite sports event â€“ theyâ€™re showing it all throughout the summer.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Brighton for Couples

sources.snippet: Coming in hot for your next date night, Komedia is the buzzing, multi-faceted venue in Brighton's North Laine. Home to two different performance spaces, this joint offers cabaret, comedy, music, club nights and so much more for your entertainment pleasure.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Brighton

sources.snippet: For a cosy and classic date night in Brighton, visit Dukeâ€™s at Komedia. This independent cinema offers a unique movie-watching experience with comfy sofas, a well-stocked bar, and a fun selection of films.
sources.shortName: things to do in brighton for couples

places.name: Komedia Brighton

reviews.text: Lovely night with a variety of comedians with different styles. The MC was incredible and really engaged the audience! Highly recommend!

Attended 28/2/2025, it  was my first time in the large room, Lovely atmosphere (apart from the 2 hecklers at the front), and you can order food!  The Headliner Dimitri Bakanov was brilliant, sharp, witty, handsome, very talented. It was a great night. Recommended.

Best venue in Brighton in my personal opinion. Drag shows, comedy nights, cinema, club and private hire available this place has it all.
Had both my birthday party and graduation celebration in their studio room for an amazing price. Every staff member is lovely and easy to work with.
Thank you Komedia!

places.address: 44-47 Gardner St, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1UN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: St Annâ€™s Well Gardens is a charming city park in Brighton and Hove, offering a mix of wooded and landscaped areas. The park features a playground, scented garden, and a delightful cafe for visitors to enjoy. Legend has it that the park's Chalybeate Spring was formed from the tears of Annafrieda, adding an air of mystic romanticism to the surroundings.

sources.snippet: Another tranquil spot is St. Annâ€™s Well Gardens, a charming park known for its serene atmosphere and beautiful botanical displays. Tucked away from the more tourist-heavy areas, this park offers a quaint garden cafÃ© where you can enjoy a warm drink amidst the sounds of nature. Itâ€™s a wonderful spot for deep conversations or a gentle stroll along its winding paths.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

places.name: St Annâ€™s Well Gardens

reviews.text:
Always a pleasure to spend time here. It would be nice to see a new more benches does along the woodland paths as it's quite difficult for the elderly and infirmed with the inclines.
Despite being small, there are lots of different areas to explore. We enjoyed the scented sensory garden, the newts in the pond, the play park, feeding the many squirrels, watching the tennis. The only problem was the garden Cafe which is a criminal rip off with itsÂ£7 for two pieces of bread and one slice of cheap thin bacon. We've been double charged too many times for it to be an incident mistake too.
So bring a picnic and a blanket and just nip to the cafe for the odd coffee or icecream

Great cafe, good food & event refreshments, all at very sensible prices in an excellent location. What are you waiting for?
Update: my return visit confirmed my previous opinion.
Update 2. As before, a great start to your day.

Cafe is still serving take away drinks. Lovely range of hot chocolate 'winter warmers' too. The counter is out doors so it feels pretty safe and the staff are obviously social distancing and taking propw safety measures.

places.address: Somerhill Rd, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Wild Flor exudes French bistro chic with its gilded mirrors, classic wine posters, wooden tables, and banquette seating. The restaurant is run by a trio of Hove locals with extensive hospitality experience and offers a menu focused on food and wine. The kitchen operates on a 'good old-fashioned carte' system and sources seasonal ingredients from the chef's allotment.

sources.snippet: If youâ€™re looking for a restaurant to impress someone special then Wild Flor is a great option. With its French elegance, luxurious food and world-class wine list, Wild Flor offers its guests a space to enjoy a truly romantic dining experience. The team have known each other for many years, coming from a background of the acclaimed Gingerman Group, and it is this that shows in their polished and seamless approach to dining.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants Brighton | Eating and Drinking for Date Night

sources.snippet: Brighton gets a lot of attention but when it comes to food, but those in the know are more likely to wander down the quieter streets of Hove to find in ..." Read our full review
sources.shortName: 39 Romantic Restaurants near Brighton

places.name: Wild Flor

reviews.text:
What an absolutely fantastic place to celebrate an anniversary! â¤ï¸
Wild Flor is just gorgeous - from the friendly greeting at the start of the evening, all the way through to settling the bill, we enjoyed every moment of our time here.
The restaurant has a really calming, cosy ambience to it. The staff are so friendly and attentive without being overbearing, and they had even written us a card wishing us a happy anniversary!! So thoughtful ðŸ¥¹
There is an extensive wine list and a great selection of cocktails - we really enjoyed our glasses of the verdinho and rosÃ©, and the Todoli Margarita we paired with our pudding was zesty, fresh and incredibly strong!! You have been warned ðŸ˜†
The star of the show at Wild Flor is, of course, the food. We kicked off with the ink battered squid, which was expertly partnered with fennel, saffron, and blood orange. I haven't had anything like this before - the combination was a bit mind-blowing!! All starters come with delicious sourdough bread and butter, too. We used ours to mop up the saffron sauce ðŸ˜‹
We chose the bavette steak and Chalk Stream trout for our mains, and shared the confit potato side dish, which was crispy and incredibly moreish. The steak was cooked to perfection. If I was being hyper-critical, I would say that the wilted spinach (which somehow seemed to have been cooked very well but still retained its crunch - impressive) was intensely garlic flavoured. I am a massive garlic fan, so not an issue - but even to me it was a little overpowering! My partner really enjoyed the Chalk Stream trout dish - I tried a piece and it was perfectly cooked.
We finished up with the aforementioned Margarita and the limequat & coconut â€˜key lime pie'. This pudding was sensational - creamy, zesty, and melt-in-the-mouth. We shared the pudding but I wish I had ordered my own one to be honest - I could have eaten 10 ðŸ˜…
Thanks so much for a wonderful evening, Wild Flor - we can't wait to come back and try many more menus!! âœ¨

The very BEST! What an awesome experience, the food was absolutely to die for, highly recommend the linguine & crab! The wine was stunning & the staff were brilliant & so friendly.  This is our second visit & both times were absolutely perfect. We can't wait to visit again, if you're in Brighton do not miss a trip to Wild Flor!

Me and my partner went here after being recommended by a chef I work with and it was fabulous! I tried the lobster special and it was the best lobster I've ever had, the potato salad and bisque was insane and everything was ultimately tasty. We also tried the beef croquettes, oysters and prawns for starters which were all delicious and perfectly prepared, my partner absolutely adored the chocolate pot for dessert as well. The wine list is perfect, I had the cheapest vinho verde as wanted to spend more on my food and it was still fantastic.
Only thing I wouldn't recommend was the margarita but that's just my personal preference (no salt rim, not on the rocks so if you like that then go for it!)
Our servers were great too, extremely good service thank you guys!

places.address: 42 Church Rd, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 2FN, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Theatre Royal Brighton, established in 1807, is a renowned and historic venue that hosts a wide array of performances including comedy, musicals, cabaret, and children's plays. Located in the heart of the Lanes, this Grade II listed building exudes elegance and grandeur. It offers a diverse program featuring touring West End musicals as well as cutting-edge contemporary theatre.

sources.snippet: Theatre Royal Brighton offers a range of performances from classic plays and cutting-edge dramas to musicals and comedy shows. Watching a live performance in the beautifully preserved Victorian theatre can be a magical experience, adding a touch of sophistication to your romantic outing.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

places.name: Theatre Royal Brighton

reviews.text: We saw the last night of the Rocky Horror Show.  WOW.  It was amazing.  It is a small venue. The old theatre has lost none of its charm.  The show was amazing, audience participation was welcome & we danced, sang & shouted Janet when appropriate.   Lots of people dressed up & the costumes on & off stage were stunning.  I would definitely go & see it again. Jason Donavon, you missed an amazing night.

This is one of the oldest theatre's in the UK, but it is well run and maintains a great atmosphere.  And they have really friendly staff. I saw a Mathew Bourne production there yesterday and it was great.

Gorgeous little theatre. I have to choose my search carefully as quite tall and not all seats have enough leg room, but that just shows it's authentically old! Staff always friendly and helpful. Love to book a matinee for easier travel home afterwards. Always a good day out. Definitely recommend!

places.address: New Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1SD, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Located in the Royal Pavilion's gardens, Brighton Museum & Art Gallery offers a diverse range of exhibits including fine and decorative art, fashion, toys, and local history. The museum underwent a significant renovation in 2002 and houses an impressive collection such as a Kinemacolour Camera from 1910, George IV's breeches, Lewis Carroll's handmade toy toolbox, water puppets from Vietnam, and the Hove amber cup.

sources.snippet: The Brighton Museum and Art Gallery offers a diverse collection that ranges from contemporary to historical art, all housed within a visually appealing Victorian building. Its intimate galleries are perfect for leisurely walks, letting you and your partner enjoy the art at your own pace while discussing your favorite pieces.
sources.shortName: The Most Romantic Spots in Brighton for A Day Out

sources.snippet: There are so many different exhibitions in Brighton Museum that itâ€™s impossible to be bored. While youâ€™re there you can even get some Pinterest inspired photos together!
sources.shortName: Winter Date Spots in Brighton -

sources.snippet: Get artsy at Brighton Museum, then discuss your favourite pieces over coffee at the museum cafÃ©. Instant intellectual brownie points!
sources.shortName: 23 of the Best Ever Brighton Date Ideas

places.name: Brighton Museum & Art Gallery

reviews.text: Always a delight to walk through. We loved the Brighton history in photos and the prehistoric Sussex sections. They are doing a great job keeping large sections of the museum open while repairing the roof. We had a buggy and access through the two floors was easy, they have a lift and clean baby changing facilities inside the museum itself.

Absolute gem although I didn't have my kids with me the day I visited, I totally noticed and appreciated how interactive and kid friendly the museum was. Will definitely be back. It was a really lovely experience.
Cute and quaint exhibitions! Very limited art selection of all the art galleries I have visited in the UK and Â£10.00 entry fee. Nice staff though and decent location.

places.address: Royal Pavilion Gardens, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1EE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Globalls in Brighton offers a unique indoor mini-golf experience under ultraviolet light. The 12-hole courses, Jurassic and Tropicana Glogolf, feature glowing dinosaurs and safari animals. The aquatic-themed course showcases neon sculptures and vibrant wall art. This fully air-conditioned venue is perfect for any day of the year. Whether you're with friends or on a date, Globalls provides an entertaining and magical experience that's sure to keep you engaged for hours.

sources.snippet: 1-5, The Village, The Waterfront, Brighton Marina, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 5WA. The perfect first date. Mini golf can help you break the ice if youâ€™re feeling a bit nervous and can introduce some competitive banter!
sources.shortName: Winter Date Spots in Brighton -

sources.snippet: Go for a hole-in-one with this fun date idea in Brighton â€“ Globalls. This glow-in-the-dark mini-golf course offers a mix of challenge and fun.
sources.shortName: things to do in brighton for couples

places.name: GLOBALLS - UV Mini Golf & Games

reviews.text: This place was great! Me and my boyfriend went here as a part of his birthday weekend and he loved it more than I did! The setup of the different golf courses were so cool too. We completed the Aquatic and Zootopia games which were surprisingly much more difficult than we anticipated. When we visited, the Jurassic game (which we originally booked) was closed due to a leak- but we were contacted before arrival asking if we wanted to change it to a different game which was equally as amazing. The staff were really helpful and the props were awesome. Would be a great day out with kids as there's food there too (and also nearby in case you want something different). We have ordered alcoholic drinks which was part of the date night deal they had which were delicious and fun! Would highly recommend going here whether it's with friends, family, or as a date.

If you have a spare hour or more get yourselves down, it's very colourful and bright. We did Aquatica and Zootopia, part of a package where we got a locker for valuables, slushie drink each, glow stick glasses or in my case glow stick bracelets (I wear glasses, so a bit difficult to wear the glow stick ones as well). It was great afternoon.
Us we really enjoy it kids go bit bored but I think just bit to hard for them if thir older than they got more out golf experience they loved ballpit best

places.address: 1-5, The Village, The Waterfront, Brighton Marina, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN2 5WA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: The Little Fish Market offers a creative seafood dining experience in an unassuming atmosphere, showcasing regional produce and local artworks. Chef Duncan Ray, formerly of The Fat Duck, emphasizes the use of locally sourced fish from British day boats to ensure unparalleled freshness.

sources.snippet: Duncan Rayâ€™s Little Fish Market is one of Brightonâ€™s most esteemed restaurants and has is perhaps the highest placed finisher overall in the Brightons Best restaurant category. The tasting menu is refined and creative, the restaurant itself has only 20 covers and, unusually for a restaurant of this size, the table is reserved for the diners for the whole night. So you can really take your time and even linger a while after, over wine conversation.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants Brighton | Eating and Drinking for Date Night

sources.snippet: If a delicious seafood meal is on the agenda, then head to The Little Fish Market where each course will be executed to perfection. Chef Duncan Ray makes sure every dish served surpasses expectations, with care and precision going into each course. The restaurant is small and intimate, a place where you can relax and enjoy the company of your other half for a truly special evening.
sources.siteName: Seen in The City - Luxury London Travel Lifestyle Magazine
sources.shortName: The Best Places to Head for a Romantic Meal in Brighton

sources.snippet: The Little Fish Market is proof positive that good things really do come in small packages. Hidden down a nondescript side street in Hove, this teeny b ..." Read our full review
sources.shortName: 39 Romantic Restaurants near Brighton

places.name: The Little Fish Market

reviews.text:
We went there for lunch on a Friday. We had made a booking, but it wouldn't have been necessary.

We got the lunch menu, which at Â£35 per person and the quality of the food is great! They started us off with bread and butter, which was delicious. The bread was sourdough bread, and had a really nice and deep flavor with a sour hint to it.

As a starter, we got the ravioli filled with salmon. The pasta itself was nicely cooked, the filling was delicious with the right amount of salmon, and the accompanying sauce acidic to break through the richness of the ravioli.

As a main we got the Gilt-Head Bream with gnocchi. The fish was crispy, but its flesh cooked just right, flaky and tender. The gnocchi were light and cloud-like. For dessert we got the cheese, and although it's not a dish that they have made themselves, the Montgomery Cheddar was a nice way to end the meal.

Service was impeccable: friendly and at the right pace. Moreover, at the end Chef Duncan himself came up to check on us and see how we enjoyed the meal, which was a nice touch.

Next time I visit Brighton I'll try to make a point to try to have dinner at the Little Fish Market.

Visited for a special occasion. Food was divine - fantastically executed and cooked to perfection. Service was friendly; the ladies were lovely, if a bit stretched as everyone arrived at the same time, we waited 25 minutes to order a drink and could tell they were doing their best. At a set Â£85 a head it was a big treat for us, so I was disappointed to be told that, although the main was listed as being part of the tasting menu, you had to select your fish which all came with a minimum supplement of Â£18 per pair, pushing it to Â£94 pp. The fish which arrived was delicious, but was probably a quarter of a fish to share, unlike the whole fish advertised on the sample menu online with no mention of extra cost. I think if you are paying this kind of money for food, it may not matter to lots of people, but I thought it should be mentioned on the website as I felt misguided and it tainted it a little for me.

Amazing food, faultless service, but a shame about the extra non-advertised charge for the fish. My partner and I had dinner here as a special treat for our anniversary, at Â£85 a head it is not our everyday meal! The food was incredible, special mention to the Thai-inspired Monkfish and the signature 'egg and soldiers'. The service was of a very high standard, with the waitress explaining every course in detail and continuously topping up our wine. The restaurant does feel a little 'cold', (decor and lighting-wise), it could use a few touches to feel a bit more cosy. The wait between courses is fairly long so be ready for that, but we had prepared ourselves for being there for a while as it was a tasting menu and of course it gave us time to chat! However the thing that was disappointing is that we had to pay a supplement for the main fish course that was not advertised anywhere on the website. This varied per fish chosen, but even the cheapest option added an extra Â£10 per person on top of an already very expensive meal. I think for Â£85 a head plus service, (total bill Â£268), this should have been included, or at least advertised to be that way on the website.

places.address: 10 Upper Market St, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 1AS, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Brighton, the Booth Museum of Natural History is a treasure trove of over half a million natural specimens and centuries-old data. The museum's permanent exhibition features lifelike displays of British birds, a killer whale skeleton, and dinosaur bones. Special exhibitions and tailored educational programs cater to visitors of all ages. Founded in 1874 by Edward Booth, the museum showcases his vast collection, including Victorian taxidermy and an impressive array of butterfly specimens.

sources.snippet: This quirky museum is perfect for those "oops, it's raining" moments. Who knew Victorian taxidermy could be so fascinating?. It's definitely one of the more unique things to do in Brighton for couples!
sources.shortName: 23 of the Best Ever Brighton Date Ideas

places.name: Booth Museum of Natural History

reviews.text: Great place. Worth a visit. Prob takes  1 to 2 hours for a visit but well.worth it. Educational, Lots of history and free, well contributions. Recommend a visit

Very good and deceptively large. It's a relatively small collection but I could have easily spent all day in there because of how many specimens there are neatly packed together. The taxidermy and skeletons are all impressive and well put-together and everything felt very tidy and well up to date. There are plenty of spots to sit, including a cozy Victorian study. Definitely a must, especially if you're interested in birds and taxidermy.

The museum was lively when my friend and I arrived! The animal displays were also varied to show the habitats of the birds, and some included prey. Not all of the animal names were visible in the glass cases portion, and there weren't additional placards providing information about each species, which I would've liked, but I may have also missed a QR code or something that led to an online guide.

The back portion was no less fun, and the informational placards there had some humor! There was one about the rhinoceros skull with artificial horns that poked fun at their value-- since they weren't real, they couldn't be used in Chinese medicine or we'd be sick or sold at cocaine-level prices.

Anyway, it's a quaint smaller museum in Brighton :) I liked it for an afternoon activity to spend a few hours in.

places.address: 194 Dyke Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 5AA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Tempest Inn is a contemporary venue located on the seafront, offering a unique dining experience with cozy seating carved into the rock and intricate wall drawings. Whether you choose to enjoy the stunning terrace or the lantern-lit interiors, this spot is perfect for those seeking great food and live music vibes. The inside bar hosts electronic music events, adding to the lively atmosphere. With cavernous interiors and a seafront terrace, Tempest offers delicious fare and fail-safe menu options from Bonito.

sources.snippet: The Tempest Inn not only hosts an intimate feel within its carved cave walls but features live music and other events. Cozy up inside during the winter, then in the summer take advantage of the extensive outdoor seating area to soak up the lively seafront atmosphere with your boo. Did we mention that they also offer Korean inspired food with plenty of vegan options?
sources.shortName: 7 of the Best Date Night Ideas in Brighton

sources.snippet: Boasting unusual cavernous interiors and dark corners to cosy up in, Tempest offers a quirky setting for your Brighton date. With great views over the seafront, grab a plate of delicious, locally sourced food, and a drink or two, before settling in for an evening spent in good company.
sources.shortName: Quirky Date Ideas In Brighton

places.name: Tempest

reviews.text:
We hosted our wedding reception on the top floor of the Tempest and could not have been happier with our choice. The atmosphere was perfect, with multiple rooms and an outside area to allow people to chat/dance/sit to eat. With the Tempest also hosting music events it meant we were able to use their speakers, decks and lights which meant our guests were dancing till the early hours!

The food package was perfect for what we needed and at great value, tasty buffet foods for soaking up drinks! The kitchen staff were also able to cater for all dietary needs which was very important to us as the Bride is a coeliac (gluten-free).

The staff were amazing! Bec sorted all of the behind the scenes organisation and explained exactly what was on offer to us. The rest of the front of house crew and chefs were great with helping us with anything we needed on the day. Especially the manager with the earpiece (who we never caught the name of, sorry!) who was very friendly and attentive. Thank you so much to everyone!

Overall, anyone reading this for event hire should not hesitate. The Tempest is such a great location to get to for multiple guests, has sea views, delicious food and friendly, helpful staff. Their refurbishment and new kitchen menu has really paid off for them. The reactions we got from our guests speak to this review too.

Tempest is an amazing pub!
This review is purely in regards to their current kitchen Puffin.

Not sure if I was unlucky but my Â£15 "roll" turned out to be a single slice of brioche bread folded in half with not a lot inside.
It was tasty, but was pretty stingy portion size wise, especially for Â£15!
It made me a bit sad.
Great food, excellent service and the location couldn't be closer to the beach! It's two very enthusiastic thumbs up from me!! ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

places.address: 159 Kings Rd, Brighton, BN1 1NB, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Rockwater Hove is a trendy beachfront destination in Brighton, offering a relaxed atmosphere and delicious meals. Located in the heart of Hove, it features two restaurants - a Bar and Kitchen and a Roof Terrace with stunning views. The venue is perfect for enjoying cocktails during sunset. With an extensive menu including pizzas, burgers, and healthy bowls, the Bar and Kitchen is an ideal spot to start your visit.

sources.snippet: Idyllically positioned on Hoveâ€™s stunning stretch of coast, with three main dining areas and fronted by a number of cafe beach huts, there really is something for everyone. The Roof Terrace, Rockwaterâ€™s top-floor restaurant is the cherry on this impressive venue. A breath-taking setting for a date night, romantic brunch or lunch, it boasts stunning views of the sea from the large open-air terrace and the enticing menu includes a fine selection of small and sharing plates from sea and land.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants Brighton | Eating and Drinking for Date Night

sources.snippet: Thousands flock to Brighton every year to enjoy the south coast, and of all the restaurants and venues lining the Brighton beachfront, Rockwater is one of t ...
sources.shortName: 39 Romantic Restaurants near Brighton

places.name: Rockwater Hove

reviews.text:
Popped in for the Easter Sunday roast. Service was great, staff were really friendly and attentive. Atmosphere is excellent with sea views as the building is as close to beachfront as you can get. Great place to meet friends, have a drink and enjoy life.

The food was probably the only downer here. Portions were generous, but my lamb roast was over-cooked (super chewy) and the meals were generally dry (not enough gravy). We chose not to have dessert because the mains disappointed.

8/10 recommend.

We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Rockwater Bar and Grill. The food was amazing all the service staff were friendly and tended to our every need. I made a request to make my wife's birthday extra special and they went above and beyond. I live 250 miles away but be sure the next time I'm in Brighton I'll be back!! Rock on Rockwater!!

I have cycled past Rockwater so many times and I've always felt an air of mystery around it. â€œThis place looks too classy for my presence?â€ I would think.

However, I finally plucked up the courage to go and suffice to say I had a pretty classy time.

Food was amazing and surprisingly fast out of the kitchen, also I'm tempted to copy some of the decorum for home. Thank you for the hospitality!

places.address: Western Esplanade, Brighton and Hove, Hove BN3 4FA, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Worlds End in Brighton is a vibrant hangout offering craft beer, vegan burgers, and an array of entertainment options. This vegan-friendly bar features retro arcade games, board games, and even virtual reality machines. Upstairs, visitors can enjoy a 10-driver remote control racetrack for added excitement. The pub also serves as an ideal starting point for a pub crawl with its proximity to other notable bars in the area.

sources.snippet: The town's premier activity pub, The World's End, is a great option for a quirky first date in Brighton. Whether you're popping in for the weekly quiz, table-top Pac-Man or remote-controlled race track, you'll be lucky if you make it through even half the entertainment it has got on offer.
sources.shortName: Quirky Date Ideas In Brighton

places.name: Worlds End

reviews.text:
Loved this pub on our weekend away here. Enjoyed the live music, the choice of beer, Great atmosphere, and great food from Bunny which we tried. The smash burger was very good, topped dirty fries were excellent ðŸ‘Œ and the chicken wings were nice and spicy ðŸ‘Œ
There's also an arcade upstairs with loads of retro games.
I wish this place was where I lived.

I was in here as part of my mates stag do on Friday 11th April.
The alcohol on offer was absolutely brilliant.
The bar staff were all helpful, and I loved the fact that they had a room upstairs full of old arcade games! Couldn't help roll back the years and have a go at Track and Field.
Recommend to all.......

Found myself here with friends late on a weekday evening following a meal out. Didn't have any of the food but had a few drinks. Was very impressed with the range of drinks available and our server, Phoebe was very polite and helpful as I was extremely undecided!  Thankfully she was able to steer me right. Would definitely visit again.

places.address: 60-61 London Rd, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 4JE, United Kingdom

places.generalDescription: Bohemia Brighton is a swanky European-style grand cafe and cocktail bar located in the heart of the South Laines. It offers a late-night lounge, glassed-in roof terrace, live jazz, and a mix of classic signature cocktails and bespoke concoctions. The bar also features a visually arresting interior with three floors, including a stylish roof terrace. Bohemia's kitchen serves full buffet options for those feeling peckish.

sources.snippet: Bohemia bar is tucked away in the Lanes, almost missable from the front but opening up inside to three floors and a roof terrace. The interior is stylishly decked out with a gothic opulence, so itâ€™s a bit like going to a modern-day party in an old European castle. Cocktails are an event at Bohemia, featuring dry ice, pyrotechnics and of course plenty of premium quality booze.
sources.shortName: Romantic Restaurants Brighton | Eating and Drinking for Date Night

sources.snippet: Bohemia is a creative cocktail bar in Brighton with a few hidden spaces and charms up its sleeve. Situated in the heart of The Lanes, Bohemia can be noticed by the glowing red lights and chuckle of drinkers dotted around its street side terrace tables. But thereâ€™s so much more to discover!
sources.shortName: 7 of the Best Date Night Ideas in Brighton

sources.snippet: Drinking cocktails should always be at the top of the list for date night and Bohemia offers up a mouthwatering selection of tipples. The bar is based in a gorgeous Edwardian building and has a jazz bar as well as a sun-trap terrace perfect for soaking up some rays.
sources.shortName: Date Ideas: Fun Things To Do For Couples In Brighton

sources.snippet: Or you have Bohemia, with its jazz bar vibe and an amazing sun terrace on the roof so you can watch the sprawling streets go by below whilst you relax and get close.
sources.shortName: Things to Do in Brighton for Couples

places.name: Bohemia Brighton

reviews.text: The flames above the entrance immediately drag you into the restaurant. Was a relatively quiet night when we were there but it's certainly a place that will be popular. Food is delicious, drinks are amazing, desserts are theatrical. Will be back next time we are in Brighton

Myself and my daughter found this place by chance on our last evening of a short trip here last week we'd already had dinner so didn't eat here unfortunately but it is now on our list to do so. We were looking for somewhere to go for a cocktail as we were leaving the next day and bit of live entertainment. We had already walked past during the day and had pointed out what a lovely place it looked so I was quite glad that we got the chance to go back. We sat by the bar and downstairs it wasn't particularly busy but the atmosphere and the place is just so welcoming warm and comfortable. It's a nice place to be in.The bar Staff were absolutely fantastic Finn was the initial bartender on his own and when it picked up, he still kept up the pace he was Making complicated cocktails for people but will still be personable fast and letting customers enjoy the cocktails that he had made. He was then joined by Callam who also worked just as hard it was in refreshing watching people enjoy their jobs. A small note I would like to also add is that I was impressed on how hot they were on ID and everybody that came into the bar. The bar started to fill up and the atmosphere just got even better. They had a live band there that evening that we're doing covers of songs and they to were very interactive and just really made the whole place come alive (the iron boot scrappers) We had some quite theatrical cocktails and a few drinks and left after a few hours, but we will definitely be back for food and more drinks the next time we are back thank you for a great time.

Amazing place that we only stumbled upon on our walk through the streets of Brighton. The staff were absolutely welcoming and provided us a table for two with no fuss! The presentation of our cocktails was over the moon and the starters we ordered were delicious too! Couldn't have asked for anything more. The place is stunning.

places.address: 54-55 Meeting House Ln, Brighton and Hove, Brighton BN1 1HB, United Kingdom
